conclusion: The slider is ejected from the spring with a speed v_B at point B.
The horizontal distance between points B and C is given as x_{BC} = 0.9 m.
The slider follows a circular arc track with a radius of 0.4 m.
The track is tangent to the ground at point D, and the angle between the track and the horizontal is 37°.
The slider experiences a frictional force as it moves along the track. The coefficient of kinetic friction is 0.4.
The horizontal distance traveled by the slider from point B to point C is x_{BC} = 0.9 m.
The vertical distance traveled is h = 0.53 m.
The horizontal component of the velocity at point C is v_C cos 37°.
The vertical component of the velocity at point C is v_C sin 37°.
The vertical displacement due to friction is calculated.
